title: France react to England World Cup match cancellation with indifference
text:
It was with a typical Gallic shrug of indifference to which Jefferson Poirot and Camille Lopez replied to the question of a possible cancellation of their match against England when they spoke to the media on Wednesday.

Not giving away any hint of anxiety Poirot said: “If the game doesn’t take place, it doesn’t matter because we are in the quarter-finals anyway. That is all that matters to me.

“Will a cancellation be a problem for our rhythm (of training)? Yes and no, we’ll be ready no matter what. A cancellation isn’t a problem.”

One pressing problem the French faced in the face of the Pool C decider being called off was a logistical one.
